column4: this is what pisses me off about linux, the only thing that does; there's no sure way of removing a program
I tried to remove kde by removing purging kubuntu-desktop, and I restart, and go to sessions and KDE is still there
can you please point me to it?
maybe to you.  however lots of other people are going to believe it, and try to get help there
actually - you get more help here - in +1, they basically tell you not to run feisty if you cant solve basic problems, and send you back to #ubuntu.
guess it was different when dapper was +1 :(
which is entirely logical, of course.  new people and people who dont know what they're doing should go back to a stable release.
well, more people were there.  but that was later in the development cycle anyway
fine, if I do sudo apt-get source blah, where does the source download to?!
that was the binaries.  source downloads to the current directory.
